tweets.text: RT @ianmiles: Elon Musk: The real breakthrough SpaceX is chasing isn‚Äôt hype ‚Äî it‚Äôs full reusability. No one in history has ever built a ful‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
Elon Musk: The real breakthrough SpaceX is chasing isn‚Äôt hype ‚Äî it‚Äôs full reusability. No one in history has ever built a fully reusable rocket, and that‚Äôs why access to space is still insanely expensive ‚Äî We‚Äôve already landed Falcon 9 boosters over 500 times, but we still throw away the upper stage ‚Äî and that alone costs as much as a small jet. Starship changes everything. When every part of a rocket comes back, space stops being exclusive and starts becoming scalable.

Starship is the largest flying machine ever made ‚Äî built for Mars, the Moon, and massive satellite deployment. But the real revolution isn‚Äôt where it goes‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs that it comes back. Full reusability is the single biggest lever for lowering the cost of space in human history.

Automation and AI matter ‚Äî but without full reusability, space will always be expensive. Starship is designed to change the economics entirely. Prove full reusability, and the cost of reaching orbit drops by a factor of 100. That‚Äôs how Mars stops being a dream and starts being a plan.
